intro: Glossorhyncha cristata, commonly known as the crested glossorhyncha, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, crested inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small and clustered, producing a range of colors from white to pink, attracting various pollinators.
